body.S: When it comes to physical activity, every little bit counts. How can you take a few extra steps today to increase your activity level and benefit your overall health?
Research shows that having social support can make a big difference in achieving physical activity goals. Try telling a friend or family member today about your exercise goals!
If you can, take some time today to stop and appreciate something positive. It could be an important friendship, a beautiful view, or another person's kind act. See how it feels!

Take some time today to think of a simple plan for how you can be more active. Make sure it is realistic and something you feel you can commit to for the next week (like walking for 20 minutes each day). Write it down and try to follow it for the next 7 days!
Exercise can boost your energy level so that you feel more energetic and motivated in general. What can you do today to exercise your body?
Research suggests that people who exercise more also live longer! It's never too late to start exercising. How about taking a walk today and making it a habit?
Did you know that exercise can help you grow new brain cells and improve your memory? Start exercising today to stay sharp!

You are more likely to stick with a physical activity routine if you enjoy what you are doing. It's helpful to try many different types of activity to find what you like most. You can start this week!
Physical activity is a great way to boost your mood. Try exercising for at least 15 minutes today and see if you feel any improvements in your mood or energy level!
What are some reasons why physical activity may be important to you? Can you think of something that motivates you to be more physically active today?
What are your barriers for physical activity? Can you brainstorm and write down a way to get around these potential barriers this week?
Sometimes social support can help you meet your physical activity goals. Try telling a friend or family member today about your goals and see if they can help you stay on track!
For some people, exercise is more fun when it is done with other people. Try finding an exercise partner this week and see how it feels!

Setbacks are a normal part of progress and improvement. What matters most is that you don't give up! Can you think of a time when you had a setback but did not give up? Use this memory as motivation to meet your physical health goals!
Sitting for long periods of time can lead to reduced strength and energy. Today, try to stand up every 30 minutes and move around!
People often focus on negative events rather than the good, positive things that happen. Today, try to notice three good things to promote gratitude and optimism!

Research indicates that life satisfaction depends less on actual events and more on what we choose to pay attention to. Today, try to focus on the positive and write down three things for which you feel gratitude!
Think back over the last several years and remember an instance when someone did something nice for you. Consider writing or calling them to express your gratitude today!

Today, think about a success you have had in your life and spend time savoring how it felt to achieve this success and how you played a role in making it happen. See if you can use this experience to build your confidence and motivation going forward!

Tracking your physical activity can be very motivating and helpful for achieving your goals. Consider using a calendar to mark off the days you are active and record how many minutes you spent being active!
One way to stay more focused on the positive aspects of your life is to use a calendar to write down one thing you are grateful for each day. Try this out today!
Scientific research suggests that performing small acts of kindness can improve your mood and how you think about yourself. Think about what you can do today to be kind to someone else!
Is there someone in your life who motivates you to be healthier? Can you spend time with them or reach out to them today?

It is often easier to add new healthy foods into your diet rather than cutting out the unhealthy foods all at once. Today, try to add some healthy foods into your meals like a large serving of vegetables!
Soda and fruit juice can contain a great deal of sugar and can actually make you feel more tired rather than energized. Instead, try to find a healthier replacement today like water, coffee, or tea!
